newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan has bids for 450,000t of U.S. or Australian wheat.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan has bids for 450,000t of U.S. or Australian wheat.

text.p: Pakistan's Ministry of Food and Agriculture said it had opened eight bids on Sunday after its side-by-side tender for 450,000 tonnes of U.S. or Australian wheat, but had made no decision.
Mehboob Ahmed, secretary at the ministry, said a committee was studying the bids and would make its final recommendations on Sunday evening. "I expect a decision by tomorrow," he added.
Another official said there had been no bids for the supply of Australian wheat. All eight bids were for U.S. soft white wheat, with the lowest at $152 per tonne and the highest about $158 per tonne.
"It seems all of them (bidders) will get something because they are all close to each other (in price)," he added.
